headline: Facebook, Twitter take down Trump post that falsely claims coronavirus is less deadly than flu
summary: "We remove incorrect information about the severity of Cobid-19, and have now removed this post," a Facebook spokesperson said in a statement to CNBC.

headline: House panel investigates political interference by White House over coronavirus at CDC and FDA
summary: The subcommittee is seeking documents and information from the FDA and CDC on agency actions, drafts submitted to the White House and changes made during the review process.

headline: Boeing slashes forecast for new aircraft demand, expects coronavirus pandemic to hurt sales for more than a decade
summary: Boeing slashed its 10-year forecast for new aircraft demand by 11% from a year ago, citing the impact of Covid-19.

The U.S. presidential debate and President Trump's positive Covid diagnosis sent reverberations across the stock market in the past week. Invesco's top strategist says investors should brace for even more volatility this month.
headline: Markets may be downplaying the chance of a contested election, says Invesco’s Kristina Hooper

summary: The divergence leaves an opening for the powerful tech companies to oppose legislation that could install greater regulatory burdens.
headline: Key GOP lawmaker lays out 'non-starters' for Big Tech antitrust reform

summary: Powell called Tuesday for continued aggressive fiscal and monetary stimulus for an economic recovery that he said still has "a long way to go."
headline: Fed Chair Powell calls for more help from Congress, says there's a low risk of 'overdoing it'

summary: By national measures, those making $400,000 or more in income belong to a rarified group. But in a city, people with that income aren't exactly living large.
headline: Biden defines $400,000 a year as 'wealthy,' but that income only makes you upper-middle-class in big cities
These three themes are driving the ETF industry in a volatile year, says head of iShares Americas
summary: Fixed income ETFs, sustainable investing and risk balancing have all become popular in 2020 as investors fielded a difficult market landscape, says Armando Senra, BlackRock's head of iShares Americas.
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell delivers his latest views on the economy Tuesday morning to a virtual gathering of the National Association for Business Economics.
headline: Watch Fed Chair Jerome Powell talk rates, the economy and pandemic stimulus live
Chamath Palihapitiya on Trump's coronavirus treatment: 'I hope we can get everything he got'
summary: Social Capital CEO Chamath Palihapitiya said of President Donald Trump's experience with the coronavirus in a "Squawk Box" interview Tuesday morning: "I'm glad he's getting better and I hope we can get everything he got."
"It's not so much about getting this bill passed in terms of, 'we want another loan.' We just want to go back to work," restaurateur Marcus Samuelsson told CNBC on Tuesday.
headline: 'Chopped' judge Marcus Samuelsson: Failure to pass restaurant aid would cost millions of jobs
What the workforce will look like in 2025 as it morphs due to pandemic
summary: Companies like Cisco are reimagining the future of work due to Covid-19 and the move towards a more remote workforce.
Consistency and time are two of the biggest factors when it comes to saving for retirement. Here's much you need to save per month to retire with $5 million, broken down by age.
headline: How much you'll need to invest per month to retire with $5 million, broken down by age
Coronavirus pandemic tests Southwest Airlines' record of no pay cuts, furloughs
summary: Southwest Airlines is asking unions for concessions to help lower costs and avoid furloughs through 2021.
Snap's VP of Sales for Americas Peter Naylor said that "advertisers do want to get back, and they are getting back into the groove."
headline: As ad market rebounds from coronavirus, Snap says it's 'feeling a lot of momentum'
AMC, Cinemark won't close theaters even as blockbusters flee 2020
summary: AMC Theaters, the largest cinema chain in the U.S., and rival Cinemark said they have no plans to shutter theaters even as additional Hollywood blockbusters postpone their release dates to next year.
The European Court of Justice (ECJ) has ruled that member states cannot collect mass mobile and internet data on citizens.
headline: EU’s top court limits government spying on citizens’ mobile and internet data
Rising levels of pandemic fatigue are being seen in Europe, WHO warns
summary: Rising levels of "Covid-19 fatigue" are being seen in Europe, the regional director of the World Health Organisation warned.

headline: Holiday crowds at the mall will be smaller this year: ShopperTrak predicts as much as 25% drop in shoppers
summary: Black Friday, the day after Thanksgiving, is still expected to be the busiest day in stores and at malls during the 2020 holiday season. But it's losing its clout.
Clover will go public via a merger with Social Capital Hedosophia Holdings Corp. III, a special purpose acquisition company.
headline: Chamath Palihapitiya to take Clover Health public in another SPAC deal worth $3.7 billion
